recumbent: lying down; in a position of comfort or rest
aver: declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true
antagonism: an actively expressed feeling of dislike and hostility
connive: form intrigues (for) in an underhand manner
bowdlerize: edit by omitting or modifying parts considered indelicate
dirge: a song or hymn of mourning as a memorial to a dead person
presumptuous: going beyond what is appropriate, permitted, or courteous
eschew: avoid and stay away from deliberately
percipient: characterized by ease and quickness in perceiving
cantankerous: stubbornly obstructive and unwilling to cooperate
discreet: marked by prudence or modesty and wise self-restraint
dissident: a person who objects to some established policy
candidly: it is sincerely the case that
philtre: a drink credited with magical power
expatiate: add details, as to an account or idea
redemption: the act of purchasing back something previously sold
edifying: enlightening or uplifting so as to encourage improvement
prodigious: great in size, force, extent, or degree
complacent: contented to a fault with oneself or one's actions
cognizant: having or showing knowledge or understanding or realization
coterie: an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose
obliterate: remove completely from recognition or memory
compunction: a feeling of deep regret, usually for some misdeed
epicure: a person devoted to refined sensuous enjoyment
festoon: a decorative representation of a string of flowers
bigoted: blindly and obstinately attached to some creed or opinion
sacrilegious: grossly irreverent toward what is considered holy
belligerent: characteristic of an enemy or one eager to fight
indifferent: marked by a lack of interest
debouch: march out (as from a defile) into open ground
augury: an event indicating important things to come
inveigle: influence or urge by gentle urging, caressing, or flattering
cumbersome: difficult to handle or use because of size or weight
jostling: the act of jostling (forcing your way by pushing)
parochial: relating to or supported by or located in a parish
machination: a crafty and involved plot to achieve your ends
stertorous: of breathing having a heavy snoring sound
consecrated: made or declared or believed to be holy
temporal: of or relating to or limited by time
jocund: full of or showing high-spirited merriment
complaisant: showing a cheerful willingness to do favors for others
trenchant: having keenness and forcefulness and penetration in thought
impending: close in time; about to occur
doyen: a man who is the senior member of a group
obstinate: marked by tenacious unwillingness to yield
rancour: a feeling of deep and bitter anger and ill-will
camaraderie: the quality of affording easy familiarity and sociability
edifice: a structure that has a roof and walls
pantomime: a performance using gestures and movements without words
evocation: stimulation that calls up a particular class of behaviors
vantage: place or situation affording some benefit
bestial: resembling a beast; showing lack of human sensibility
afflatus: a strong creative impulse; divine inspiration
captious: tending to find and call attention to faults
surrealism: an artistic movement using fantastic and incongruous images
forbearance: a delay in enforcing rights or claims or privileges
elated: exultantly proud and joyful; in high spirits
remission: an abatement in intensity or degree
tantalize: harass with persistent teasing or baiting
envision: imagine, conceive of, or see in one's mind
cognoscente: an expert able to appreciate a field
leitmotif: a melodic phrase that accompanies a person or situation
forthright: directly and without evasion; not roundabout
tumultuous: characterized by unrest or disorder or insubordination
musty: covered with or smelling of mold
foolhardy: marked by defiant disregard for danger or consequences
renegade: someone who rebels and becomes an outlaw
qui vive: condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action
sinecure: a job that involves minimal duties
distend: cause to expand as if by internal pressure
fortitude: strength of mind that enables one to endure adversity
brickbat: a fragment of brick used as a weapon
inadvertent: happening by chance or unexpectedly or unintentionally
dehumanize: deprive of the positive qualities of a person
archival: of a depository containing historical records and documents
protract: lengthen in time; cause to be or last longer
paltry: contemptibly small in amount or size
demur: politely refuse or take exception to
apposite: being of striking appropriateness and pertinence
gratification: the act or an instance of satisfying
efficacious: giving the power to produce an intended result
profundity: the quality of being physically deep
browbeat: discourage or frighten with threats or a domineering manner
supplant: take the place or move into the position of
reconnoiter: explore, often with the goal of finding something
desuetude: a state of inactivity or disuse
chagrined: feeling or caused to feel uneasy and self-conscious
purport: have the often specious appearance of being or intending
somber: grave or even gloomy in character
complicity: guilt as a confederate in a crime or offense
demure: shy or modest, often in a playful or provocative way
flabbergasted: as if struck dumb with astonishment and surprise
qualm: uneasiness about the fitness of an action
pliant: capable of being influenced or formed
idiosyncrasy: a behavioral attribute peculiar to an individual
maven: one who is very skilled in or knowledgeable about a field
ruefully: in a manner expressing pain or sorrow for sins or offenses
funereal: suited to or suggestive of a grave or burial
repudiate: refuse to acknowledge, ratify, or recognize as valid
fathomable: (of depth) capable of being sounded or measured for depth
extradite: hand over to the authorities of another country
condescending: characteristic of those who treat others with arrogance
chronicle: a record or narrative description of past events
emaciate: grow weak and thin or waste away physically
officious: intrusive in a meddling or offensive manner
exultant: joyful and proud especially because of triumph or success
puerile: displaying or suggesting a lack of maturity
nonconformist: someone refusing to follow established standards of conduct
halcyon: a mythical bird said to breed at the winter solstice
expurgate: edit by omitting or modifying parts considered indelicate
disinterested: unaffected by concern for one's own welfare
masticate: bite and grind with the teeth
amorphous: having no definite form or distinct shape
predicate: involve as a necessary condition or consequence
nigh: near in time or place or relationship
sang-froid: great coolness and composure under strain
stench: a distinctive odor that is offensively unpleasant
chimera: a grotesque product of the imagination
